intro: Phebalium phylicifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved peacock wattled-plant, is a shrub native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its aromatic, glandular leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, followed by woody, ribbed fruits. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
